intro: Hicorius austrina, commonly known as the Australian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils. It features broad, heart-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Hicorius austrina is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in warm, sunny climates.
